scenarioDescription:
The HD 24064 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 24064 is a star with 1.61 times the mass of the Sun, and 40 times its radius. It is located 979.27 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 24064 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 24064 system


HD 24064 b

HD 24064 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory, in 2015-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 24064 b is 4099.020 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 24064 b is 12.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 24064 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 24064, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
name: HD 24064 - System With 1 Exoplanet
